Once agreed and defined, the Chairman of the Board and the Chairperson of the Compensation Committee approve the final objectives in their entirety, It is important to note that the baseline for the various objectives contained in the CEO’s scorecard (e.g. the threeiyear midterm plan or budget, quantitative Group level goals, etc.) is approved by the Board of Directors.

Objective setting for the Executive Board members The objective-setting process for the Executive Board members mirrors that of the CEO; however, it is the CEO who meets with each member at the Executive Board to discuss and determine the key performance objectives for the upcoming performance year.
